channel.title: New directions in social sciences
channel.description:
A series of talks delivered before the annual convention of the American Psychological Association in San Francisco.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Psychopathology and politics
item.description: This program presents the first part of a talk by Harold Lasswell, Yale Law School, and Richard Christie, Research Center for Human Relations, called "Psychopathology and Politics."
item.dc:creator: Pacifica Radio
item.dc:subject: Social sciences.

item.title: Analogy in science
item.description: The first part of Dr. J. Robert Oppenheimer's keynote address, "Analogy in Science."
item.dc:creator: Pacifica Radio
item.dc:subject: Social sciences.

item.title: Effects of male hormones on women
item.description: This program presents a talk by John I. Wheeler called "Psychological Effects of Male Hormones on Women."
item.dc:creator: Pacifica Radio
item.dc:subject: Social sciences.

item.title: Interviews with American males
item.description: Harold Renaud, "Life History Interviews with American Males."
item.dc:creator: Pacifica Radio
item.dc:subject: Social sciences.

item.title: Extensions of psychological concept
item.description: Franz Alexander, Institute for Psychoanalysis, Chicago, "Extensions of Psychological Concepts."
item.dc:creator: Pacifica Radio
item.dc:subject: Social sciences.

item.title: Analogy in science
item.description: The conclusion of Dr. J. Robert Oppenheimer's keynote address, "Analogy in Science."
item.dc:creator: Pacifica Radio
item.dc:subject: Social sciences.

item.title: Psychopathology and politics
item.description: This program presents the second part of a talk by Harold Lasswell, Yale Law School, and Richard Christie, Research Center for Human Relations, called "Psychopathology and Politics."
item.dc:creator: Pacifica Radio
item.dc:subject: Social sciences.

item.title: Current and future advances
item.description: This program presents a talk by Harry F. Harlow, Psychology Department, University of Wisconsin called "Current and Future Advances in Comparative Psychology."
item.dc:creator: Pacifica Radio
item.dc:subject: Social sciences.
